constituent: departed, fold, finger, fingers, axe, road
heisigStory: The connotation is of a "dearly departed" who has passed away. The elements: fold . . . road.
koohiiStory1: One of the dearest of Japan´s dearly departed is Sasaki Sadako, who developed Leukemia after the bombing of Hiroshima, and became famous for folding more than a thousand paper cranes, never giving up hope. To this day, people in Hiroshima still fold origami cranes in her memory. For this character, let us imagine a parade in her honor, the entire road lined with folded cranes.
koohiiStory2: The BIG ONE hits Tokyo. You see a news report of the recently departed victims who died when the roads folded (from the earthquake).
